data.title: So much better than the tried and true
data.text: The main enticement of Cuff is that many dishes takes an innovative approach. For example, I had the potsticker posole. Delicious! You might also enjoy sweet chili calamari, or a straightforward cheeseburger. The ambiance is well-lit but wood paneled. It feels like home in a way.

data.title: Excellant Food!
data.text: I had the Dumpling Soup & it was wonderful. Unfortunately the cook is leaving & the Asian food portion of the menu is going to be removed. Hopefully, they will find someone to take his place & will be able to make some of his Asian goodies. At least the burgers will still remain & they are very good, too as are the salads.

data.title: Great service and great meals!
data.text: They have nice beers on tap and the waiter was very kind to us. The meat was very tender and tasteful with a nice salad on the side.

data.title: Really Good Dinner
data.text:
We stopped in for dinner on a recent Saturday evening and we were very glad we did.

The staff was very friendly and attentive.

We had the deviled eggs to start and they were delicious.  Cuff has a good selection of beers.  We had fish & chips and dumpling soup.  Both were very good.  We split the watermelon pie for desert....it was interestingly refreshing!

There was plenty of parking very close to the restaurant.

We'll be back

data.title: Lovely Family Owned Restaurant
data.text: The good reviews are true!  The food is delicious, service attentive and everything was very reasonably priced. The BBQ pork shoulder sandwich and the fish tacos were stand-outs.

data.title: Good Happy Hour Menu
data.text: Four of us girlfriends were getting together for dinner, and one of the gals chose this place due to location and good reviews. I liked the look of the place, kind of urban trendy. The 4 of us met just after 5 pm on a Thursday night. It was Happy Hour pricing, $2-$3 off regular pricing, which was cool. I had the Pork Belly Tacos, with a small mixed green salad. Both were very tasty. 2 gals had the Tequila Lime Fish Tacos (one had grilled, the other fried fish). Both said it was good. Our 4th gal ordered the Eggplant Parmesan sandwich with a side mixed green salad. All of us finished everything on our plate. One of my girlfriends had a Cosmo. She said it was good, although she felt it was a bit on the small side for what she paid. We all agreed that if this place was in Scottsdale, it would probably be crowded. Food was tasty, service was fine. Why the Average rating? While we did like that we could easily have a conversation with each other, there weren't enough people there to really give it a good, active vibe. Maybe we were there on a really slow night at a really slow time...

data.title: Best French Fries in Town
data.text:
This is a small cozy place in old Glendale.  With a small bar in the front and maybe 15 tables past that, seating is limited.  I expect that may cause an issue at lunch but during the evenings that I have been there the place has been at most 1/2 full.  This is a real shame because the food is very good.

My personal favorite is the pulled pork sandwich & fries.  The sandwich is piled high with pork with a very hot BBQ sauce.  The sandwich is accompanied by fries that are to die for, crisp and spiced pepper and other spices.

There are a few vegetarian options, a curry dish that received high marks from my dining companion. 

The largest drawback in Cuff is the service which is mediocre. Each time we have been there the servers have been less than attentive, our glasses remained empty for extended periods and due to the "shotgun" layout, it is difficult to get the server's attention.  In one case the server was much more involved in hanging out in the bar area.

All in all, a yummy neighborhood find.

data.title: Visit this place!
data.text: In original Glendale you'll find this unique restaurant at the main square area.  Lovely restored building with a nice patio seating area in the back.  The four of us purposely got different dishes so we could have a taste of each.  The fish fry was incredibly flaky and tasty.  The hamburger was delicious.  The posole was spicy and full of flavor.  The dumpling noodle soup was really good and could have fed all four of us.  The charcuterie board and deviled eggs were great appetizers.  Our wait staff was excellent and friendly who shared good advice on what to order.  Even the side salad was excellent.  Go and enjoy dinner!

data.title: Great place to have a hamburger and a beer.
data.text: We popped in looking for our hotel which the owner, David helped us find.  He also showed us the menu and pointed out the Wednesday special:  Hamburger and a beer for 10 bucks.  The burger was delicious with a special blend of meats that the owner prized David was very friendly and we chatted for sometime while we waited for our food.  There was a good selection of domestic and craft beers as well.

data.title: Glendale Showcase
data.text: We met some distant cousins for dinner and sat on the patio.  March is the best time to sit outside and eat.  The brisket was super tender, but the coleslaw was only shredded cabbage and more like a garnish.( I thought it came with coleslaw.) The appetizers were super delicious.  I will be visiting again.

data.title: Very good....but
data.text:
Appetizers of calamari and deviled eggs were great.
Chicken dish was excellent. Brisket was not a keeper. Dry and tough. Drinks were VG next time I'll try there version of a Russian Mule.

data.title: Right at Home
data.text: My wife and I live in Glendale.We heard about Cuff from friends.All that I can say is that they were right.Go for the shrimp p.o. boy sandwich.Stay for the deviled eggs.You will not be sorry.

data.title: Soooo good
data.text: Loved the food ordered here they actually have two different kitchens and menu types one is American type foods and the other is Asian super tasty and fresh. I ordered the Chop sooee and was very good. The food here just seems simple yet tasty. My friends ordered a burger and the other the lemon chicken the lemon chicken was fried and very tasty. Definitely will be coming back.

data.title: What a uniqe experience! Here you get two kinds of cuisines in one place! American and Asian.
data.text: Here you get two kinds of cuisines in one place! American and Asian. The food is fantastic. I have tried the burger, calamari, Fish Taco and a variety of Asian dishes They are all delicious and my favorite soup is Asian Dumpling, YOU have got to try it. They also have a full bar with a variety of very tasty mix drinks. Service is friendly. They make you feel at home. I read, they are on the top 10 actually #6 restaurants in the entire west valley.

data.title: Nice place to go with freinds
data.text: On a Saturday night I meet some friends here. While the menu is not large there are many good things to eat. The four of us each had something different and everyone enjoy their food. While they did not have a dedicated gluten free menu. I was able for eat with suggestions from the owner. Nice

data.title: I will be back !
data.text: As indicated by other reviewers, this restaurant offers a very interesting menu.   The 'American' dishes are quite unique, richly flavored (many quite spicy) and nicely presented.   The 'Asian' food was fabulous.   We tried all the noodle dishes and soups offered the night we were there.  Excellent.  Prices were quite reasonable.   I will definitely be back.

data.title: Yummy Tacos
data.text: We stopped here in the middle of the afternoon last week for some lunch.  There is an outdoor patio in the back and we were the only ones out there.  Sometimes random people used this as a cut through.  I ordered the fish taco's and they were super delicious. The service was good - we didn't have to wait long for our meals.  I would eat here again.

data.title: The American tradition of food
data.text: Talk about some amazing food. The deviled eggs with little strips of bacon on top are delicious. Loving the traditional steak burger with some seasoned fries. The place looks nice, very clean and a few distinct features within the atmosphere that makes it look better. Staff are doing a great job at work providing excellent customer service. This a restaurant that downtown Glendale should be treasuring.

data.title: Decent Happy Hour in Downtown Glendale
data.text:
Went on a hot Saturday around 4:00. Happy Hour 3-6. Sat at a booth. It's in an old building dating to late 1800's. Neat ceiling, you can see some of the original brick. 

Served by Chris, one of the owners. No beers on tab but an interesting selection of bottles. Besides, Bud etc, Stone, Odells. I had a Nebraska Brewing Co. IPA, very good, and an AfterMath from a brewery in Temecula. Normally $5 they are $4 on Happy Hour. Pinot $4 Happy Hour but my wife wanted Moscato. $9 for an Italian one, a little pricey.

We had Deviled eggs as an appetizer ($5 Happy Hour), 6 with bacon. They were good. I had Fish Tacos Happy Hour $8. My wife had Pulled Pork $9 HH. Both were good.

Chris and his Dad, Dave said they are hoping to add taps soon which would be great and pull in more business. The Patio in the back looks nice but not in August.

Will go back in October and check it out.

data.title: I am sure there are better places near here
data.text:
My mother and I went on a Monday afternoon for lunch. The place is very cute, has a lot of character. 
I can only assume the manager/owner was in a business meeting at the first booth when you walk in. When he noticed there was no one there he sat us at a table. It took roughly 10 minutes for the server to even acknowledged us and at that point there was only one other table..
The food was I would say less than average. I ordered the steak burger with no top bun and with salad. My mom ordered the eggplant parm sandwich. I asked for my steak burger to be cooked medium well and it was definitely not medium well. My mom's seemed to be all bread and two very paper thin pieces of eggplant parm. The server was nice but you could tell he was busy. I found it odd that the manager/owner did not offer any assistance to his sole server. I probably wont be back and if I do, I will sit at the bar.
